methods.applyUpdate:
Apply this update to this SelectAndViewAnalyzer.

:param upstream: (io.deephaven.engine.table.impl.Listener.Update) - the upstream update
:param toClear: (io.deephaven.engine.table.impl.utils.RowSet) - rows that used to exist and no longer exist
:param helper: (io.deephaven.engine.table.impl.select.analyzers.SelectAndViewAnalyzer.UpdateHelper) - convenience class that memoizes reusable calculations for this update
methods.calcEffects:
Our job here is to calculate the effects: a map from incoming column to a list of columns that it effects. We do
 this in two stages. In the first stage we create a map from column to (set of dependent columns). In the second
 stage we reverse that map.

:return: java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]>
methods.create:
:param mode: io.deephaven.engine.table.impl.select.analyzers.SelectAndViewAnalyzer.Mode
:param columnSources: java.util.Map<java.lang.String,io.deephaven.engine.table.impl.sources.ColumnSource<?>>
:param rowSet: io.deephaven.engine.table.impl.utils.TrackingRowSet
:param parentMcs: io.deephaven.engine.table.impl.ModifiedColumnSet
:param publishTheseSources: boolean
:param selectColumns: io.deephaven.engine.table.impl.select.SelectColumn...
:return: io.deephaven.engine.table.impl.select.analyzers.SelectAndViewAnalyzer
